nodes.title: Refactor/isolation
nodes.body:
enforce deeper isolation during R CMDs to keep the pkgr.yml self contained

prevents conflicts against env vars or other settings in user/site level Renv/profiles.

This will likely need more iteration to allow opt-in of certain globally set information.
nodes.bodyText:
enforce deeper isolation during R CMDs to keep the pkgr.yml self contained
prevents conflicts against env vars or other settings in user/site level Renv/profiles.
This will likely need more iteration to allow opt-in of certain globally set information.

nodes.title: implement Rscripting so can run arbitrary R code to get necessary metadata
nodes.body: Useful for things like inspecting which version of R is running
nodes.bodyText: Useful for things like inspecting which version of R is running

nodes.title: fix: error if non-200 result returns with html instead of PACKAGES
nodes.body:
also catch goroutine panic on closed channel as if the first repo failed
the func would return and close the channel before the
other goroutine could send

fixes #25
nodes.bodyText:
also catch goroutine panic on closed channel as if the first repo failed
the func would return and close the channel before the
other goroutine could send
fixes #25

nodes.title: feat: environment variable expansion
nodes.body:
example of use in multirepo-source shows replacing a url with an environment variable

this will also help when using pkgr within matrix builds, such as installing iteratively where a single config file can be used.

This compliments viper's ability to detect environment variables with the prefix `PKGR`

so could still do `PKGR_Library` instead of `Library: path/to/lib`, however viper could not directly support configuration files themselves, where situations such as: `Library: some/path/with/${somevar}` are reasonable.
nodes.bodyText:
example of use in multirepo-source shows replacing a url with an environment variable
this will also help when using pkgr within matrix builds, such as installing iteratively where a single config file can be used.
This compliments viper's ability to detect environment variables with the prefix PKGR
so could still do PKGR_Library instead of Library: path/to/lib, however viper could not directly support configuration files themselves, where situations such as: Library: some/path/with/${somevar} are reasonable.

nodes.title: Cleanup/dl messages
nodes.body: goal to clean up and refactor the logging to reduce message clutter, especially at the info level, as well as simplify the logging interface
nodes.bodyText: goal to clean up and refactor the logging to reduce message clutter, especially at the info level, as well as simplify the logging interface

nodes.title: Feat/env
nodes.body:
add the capability to set environment variables during installation of packages. 

The overall internal representation is to now store two sets of env variables - global ones that should be applied to every package during install, as well as local ones per package.
nodes.bodyText:
add the capability to set environment variables during installation of packages.
The overall internal representation is to now store two sets of env variables - global ones that should be applied to every package during install, as well as local ones per package.

nodes.title: wip: Explore/jc
nodes.body: Not necessarily meant to be merged, but I'm setting up a branch to let myself learn this repo and I thought this would be a good way to get feedback on anything I might try.

nodes.title: Fix/rpath
nodes.body:
in response to #65 this fixes setting non-default R paths as for the execution of R. 

Primarily focused on environments with multiple versions of R present
nodes.bodyText:
in response to #65 this fixes setting non-default R paths as for the execution of R.
